comment.body: Like GitHub Pages?
@mv00_: The only problem: how should be JS files loaded? Git objects are just objects, and they are compressed, so it cannot be a usual `<script>`.
@mv00_: And images?
@mv00_: And what if automatically catch opening css and js files and load them via JS?
Or at least add special function like `loadScript` and `loadCss`
@mv00_: Maybe just a `gitcenter.bit/repo/pages/?...` link?
@mv00_: BTW, I've posted `Git Center` and `CodeR` to repository index. Can you help me seed them please?
And now?
@mv00_: BTW, remember bigcat.tk? It's using CoinHive now. And RVRE (or some other search, I don't remember) also uses it. Funny!
@Krixano: Yeah, now I recall.
@Krixano: Any ideas about pages?
@mv00_: But at least you give ideas!
@mv00_: I just enjoy when somebody uses what I create.
Did both `Git Center` and `CodeR` load?
@mv00_: Yeah. I and @Krixano: used ZeroMe as chat for a few times and spoiled activity feed :)
@mv00_: I'm trying to publish it to bigcat.tk.
@mv00_: @Krixano: I practically loaded CodeR to bigcat.tk. Does it work now?
@Krixano: @mv00_: Do you have a proxy to try to publish to?
@mv00_: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h/1510560577 There's also a theme for other sites.
@Krixano: The file that cannot be downloaded by bigcat.tk is 2 MB. Maybe that's a problem? (???)
@Krixano: Have you heard something about gitcratic?
@Krixano: I've added somewhat muting to settings. Could you please check? Git Center automatically adds/removes field from data/users/content.json currently.
@mv00_: Are you using Firefox or what?
@mv00_: Then you can press `Stylish`, then `...`, `Create style`, `Mozilla Format`, `Import`, paste, `Replace style`, set title, `Save`.
@mv00_: That's ok.
Could you please describe more? Do you expect the same newsfeed to be both on ZeroHello and Git Center?

@mv00_: Maybe that is. So do you expect it like:
> Git Center is ...
> `New Repository` `Beginner's Guide`
>
> Feed
on homepage?
@mv00_: Is what you say a bug report or a feature request?
@mv00_: I just thought that NewsFeed on ZeroHello is enough.
@mv00_: Fine.
@mv00_: @Nofish: A bug. I sent you a PR here: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/pull/108
@mv00_: Though I am not sure if my PR will fix this. Maybe your `data.json` is corrupted?

@mv00_: Nofish is in red hub, could you check if you are there? i.e. get your id (visit 0ch.anonymous, then go to sidebar, you will see `unique address` or something like that), open red hub `data/users` directory, check if there is a folder named as your id.
@霸王寨第一光头: You are correct.
@Nofish: @mv00_: Yes, most hubs don't accept 0ch.anonymous, but then signing should fail, not JSON parsing.
@mv00_: Please give a link to that comment.
@mv00_: You want to comment on red hub, but that hub doesn't accept 0ch.anonymous. Can you try ZeroID?
@mv00_: I mean, you can see the comment, but signing fails because only ZeroID is allowed, so only you see it.
@mv00_: So, if you want to comment on post which is in red hub, blue hub or some other hub that doesn't accept 0ch.anonymous, you will have to use ZeroID.
@mv00_: On Nofish's post?
@mv00_: Maybe you see your comment and others don't.
What Sirenyc's post?

@mv00_: So one of the problems of hubs is decentralization, though that's what we all struggle for. Each hub has its own limits, including auth providers. So, unfortunately, the only provider every hub accepts is ZeroID.
@mv00_: Yes, like that. Except that hub owners clone some hub and `invent new software version`, then others clone it... And now there are no hubs that are the same (except some Tamas'es hubs).

Stop ZeroNet. Open your `users.json`. You will find something like this:
```
      "zeroid.bit": {
        "auth_address": "1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di", 
        "auth_privatekey": "...", 
        "auth_type": "web", 
        "auth_user_name": "gitcenter", 
        "cert_sign": "..."
      }
```
Backup this part somewhere and then delete it (be careful about commas). Start ZeroNet. Now you can register new ZeroID account.

If you would want to restore your old account, do the above, but instead of removing, replace with saved part. (but backup new ZeroID)
@mv00_: Why?
@mv00_: Never mind
@霸王寨第一光头: What do you mean by webshell?
This is true only for ZeroBoard. It is very old and thus not decentralized. But all other sites including ZeroMe and ZeroTalk are decentralized.
You may have to wait for a long time before you get your id.
